column4: my cpu is using 100% while I watch avi files with totem..... with past versions it never was that high any idea why anyone?
that usually indicates a memory leak or other problem.
poorly written code can easily 'leak' memory.
but this is a freshly installed version of 8.10
it should settle down, it must be chewing on something difficult.
nothing else is running when I try to view the avi file ith totem it goes from 1% cpu to 99%-100%
could be a codec issue or a corrupted avi
I thought of that so I tried 4 other avi files and they all ran the cpu up to 100%
re-install totem might help. not sure.
I did that too and installed all the plugins and re-installed and I tried another movie player kmplayer etc all the same 100% cpu
yeah its odd I can put those avi's on my vista machine and it doesnt increase the cpu over about 20% and both boxes have the same cpu
i would suspect the codecs used to create the file you're viewing.
and this has only happen with 8.10
I think I am going back to 8.04
your resources are a factor also.
